title: Numbers, Currencies, and Digital Money

sections.title: Currencies and Money
sections.content:
In this lesson, we learn about common currencies and physical money.

- **Dollar**: Dólar ($)
- **Euro**: Euro (€)
- **Pound**: Libra (£)
- **Cash**: Efectivo
- **Coins**: Monedas
- **Notes / Bills**: Billetes
- **Credit Card**: Tarjeta de crédito

sections.title: Digital Money
sections.content:
Today, we also use money on our phones and computers.

- **E-wallet**: Monedero electrónico (e.g., Apple Pay, Google Pay)
- **Online Banking**: Banca en línea
- **Crypto / Bitcoin**: Criptomonedas
- **Transfer**: Transferencia

sections.title: Large Numbers
sections.content:
In finance, we use large numbers every day.

- **One hundred**: 100
- **Five hundred**: 500
- **One thousand**: 1,000
- **Ten thousand**: 10,000
- **One million**: 1,000,000

sections.title: Grammar: Verb 'to be'
sections.content:
The verb 'to be' is essential for describing money.

- **I am** a banker. (Yo soy banquero)
- **It is** ten dollars. (Son diez dólares)
- **They are** euros. (Son euros)

**Negative:**
- It **is not** (isn't) expensive. (No es caro)
- They **are not** (aren't) pounds. (No son libras)

objectives: Count up to one million in English
Use the verb 'to be' to describe money and professions
